column4: In openoffice, is there any safety copies made during editing of a file? Somehow the document I was writing on didn't save itself although I clicked save. And now I've closed it and the new text is gone.
Are you sure you aren't just looking in the wrong directory? ( you might have saved the newer versions somewhere else )
I'm very sure.. if it was another document it should be in recent docs and it isn't..
You don't know if changes in documents are logged or something? Maybe if there's a program that can scan my memory for the text?
Have you closed Open Office since you were working on the most up to date version?
No I haven't.. I was wondering if I should force quit it?
NO
would this work? https://help.ubuntu.com/community/DataRecovery
There is something you should try first
oki.. I'm listening
In a terminal run "lsof | grep office"
That should show all files currently opened by open office
lsof | grep office | grep odt should show only otd documents that are open
Yeah I can see the file.. but the problem is that I opened it again after the close.. so it's prolly just the old version..?
If you only see one then yes, it's whatever version you currently have
So I'm toasted? I really need that file..
At this point it will probably take less time to just re-do it
It's my exam work I've been writing on for the whole day.. are you sure it'll take that long?
If you haven't found it by now
At least re-writing it you have an idea of when it will be done, you could waste a day and be no closer trying to recover what you lost
Sorry, I have to leave. Good luck
=/ well thanks for at least trying...
